FuncDef:
The qos buffer headroom-pool command configures the chip-level headroom buffer threshold.
The undo qos buffer headroom-pool command cancels the configuration. The qos buffer headroom-pool command configures the chip-level headroom buffer threshold. The undo qos buffer headroom-pool command cancels the configuration. By default, the chip-level headroom buffer threshold is not configured. This command is supported only on the CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE6885-LL (low latency mode), CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: qos buffer headroom-pool size <size> { kbytes | mbytes } slot <slot-id>
undo qos buffer headroom-pool [ size <size> { kbytes | mbytes } ] slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the headroom buffer threshold.
For the CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer that ranges from 16 to 30720, in kbytes.
For the CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE8850-SAN, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P and CE8850-HAM:The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 2048, in kbytes.
For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):The value is an integer that ranges from 16 to 9216, in kbytes.

Specifies the slot ID.
The value is an integer. You can enter the question mark (?) and select the value as prompted.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] qos buffer headroom-pool size 1 mbytes slot 1
[~HUAWEI] qos buffer headroom-pool size 4 mbytes slot 1
ExtraInfo: To absorb more packets from a link, run this command.
